place_description: Hip site with a wide variety of food & bar stands plus art, events & indoor-outdoor seating.

reviews_data.review_text: I come for the Dumpling...always. I want to try other places but the dumpling always pull me in.
A great place for any food that your craving, and it has a huge bar with a great knowledgeable staff!
Unique food hall with a handful of small shops.  Great selection of so many different food options.  Worth stopping in.

Check #94 on April 7,
Cashier was very polite, attentive and patient as she thoroughly explained all the menu items.

However, The burger was extremely salty and I was concerned about eating it all.
We eat at Noble Smoke. The food was outstanding. My husband had the brisket sandwich, fries and mac & cheese. I had pulled chicken   and mac & cheese. You could taste the smoke in the food.
Nice to relax and eat.
Great hangout spot with lots of great food options and some cute shops.
Lots of good choices.
Great location for a variety of food and drinks.
Great food hall
Love this place. So many great food options, always a fun experience for the whole family. A little pricey, but there are mostly  upscale restaurants/food stands here
Awesome food choices and ambiance. We went twice during our 5 nights stay.

I love a good food hall! They are creative spaces where a group or family can all individually eat and enjoy whatever you prefer. I picked Optimist Hall because my son needed some play time, and I wanted coffee and an acai bowl. It was my first time at Optimist and it was early in the day so there wasn't a crowd. I ended up shopping at the Plant Shop too getting 2 cute new babies. My daughter and I both enjoyed Acai Bowls from Paradiso. They were reasonable priced about $10 each item. I grabbed coffee from the spot directly next door and my son got fries from the burger spot on the parking side of the building. I really loved the outdoor seating. The cute little court yard makes the space amazing. This is a great spot to meet a friend for coffee, a safe date spot or a mommy and me play date and lunch. Oh and parking is free for the first 90 minutes.
Cool place to hangout
Lots of different options, good choice for a bigger group that wants different things to eat. Great food and service considering the amount of people on a weekend
Optimist Hall is a cool place with lots of options to choose from. Good food and good vibes!!
We had a variety of ethnic styles of food . Interesting layout of an old landmark building
The best food-hall in charlotte, which hosts a great selection of different cultures and food categories.

Optimist Hall is an awesome spot to try out a mix of delicious foods in a fun and lively setting. It can get a little busy, but the variety and quality make it totally worth it. Whether you're grabbing a quick bite, meeting up with friends, or going on a casual date, there's something for everyone. Plus, you get 90 minutes of free parking, which is a nice bonus!

It's a very trendy cool place to hang out.  I ate at nobles and it was delicious .  Optimist hall is a place i won't come back to.  Parking is limited and I don't like to be in large crowds but it is certainly a cool spot
So many great food options. Always something good to try no matter what you're in the mood for.
Very cool food hall with stores and many food shops with a wide variety of options. Definitely a must visit in Charlotte!
If you can't find food here you are the problem
Great place to grab a bite.
Think of a mall food court with better food and atmosphere. Great place to take th undecided.
Great location for a quick lunch or dinner. There's plenty of options for every one and there's free parking for 90 minutes.

The best place to dine in Charlotte, no joke! I go here at least once a week. Best place for large groups as you can all order from any place you'd like. Great environment and truly spectacular food for really reasonable prices. Shopping and multiple bars also add a nice touch.
So fun! Tons of restaurants, bars, and shops. Great seating options, outdoor games. Great for all ages
I am addicted to Suarez Bakery... Fantastic Cuban food where any selection will be good.
I love this place. It's relaxing. I love the vibe you get there. I could really go there alone and chill if I needed alone time.
Loved it. Lots of options vibe was amazing!!
Jiu Chang Fang Gai Zao Er Cheng De Mei Shi Zhong Xin ,You Quan Shi Jie Ge Di Shi Wu . Huan Jing Kuan Chang Ming Liang !

Loved being able to get Poke bowl, a turkey Reuben and a triple cheese grilled cheese... everyone could eat what they enjoyed!! We bought at the plant stiores/ Suarez bakery/ and got great pencils and cards!! Great Sunday outing!!
Love this place! Great place to take friends and family who aren't from Charlotte!

I've many wonderful things about Optimists Hall! So it was about time to visit and boy was it worth it! The different smells just pulls you in so many directions. Whatever you're feeling it's there! BBQ, hot dogs, Asian, Sweets and everything in between! We ate at Boa but will leave them a separate review. This pace offers everything and then some. You also have the option on eating outside with friends while looking at uptown! Go visit it's certainly worth it!!

Visited the Plant store, Felix Empanadas (incredibly delicious options), and Harriet's Hamburger (the only place, I go to if I'm craving a good burger) on my lunch break, but I definitely want to revisit and explore all of Optimist Hall.
Variety of food and a great atmosphere for family or couples or just going alone

It's definitely worth the drive, beautiful setup. Went there with family some time ago and they loved the scene.

Many, many restaurants.

Super chill, outside and inside eating. Plenty of places to sit. Never worry about if you will have a place to sit.

I've tried 3 restaurants there so far and plan go back in the future to try another.

Super clean, you literally can go to the bathroom and feel like someone actually cleaned it . Sad but true.

The atomisphere was very soothing and joyful. All types of foods was available. Even Egyptian food was available and tasty. Thank you for that experience and parking was free for 90 minutes. The place was jumping today very nice
There are a lot of choices here. I can always find something every time I eat here.

Excellent variety of options to choose from in a family friendly environment.  Parking is a bit of a challenge on Saturdays. International flavors for those looking to step out of their comfort zone.  BBQ option is an "A" plus experience.
Great place with variety of food options along with good vibes

The food hall had an industrial feel that gave off millennial and modernist vibes. There were plenty of food vendors to choose from a variety of cuisines along with some stores that didn't sell prepared food.
A great place to meet up with friends with indoor or outdoor seating.  A variety of food choices,  sure to please every palate.
Tried Ethiopian food, it was really good.
Good food
Fun as hell. Great date spot.

Such a great place to go and have a tone of options. I always take my friends who are new to Charlotte here. Seating can sometimes be very limited depending on how busy it is but that's the only gripe I have.
Really cool old textile mill renovated into a food hall with unique indoor and outdoor seating.

Awesome place to go with plenty of food stops and bar scenes. The patios are tremendously inviting and comfortable. The staff, as well as the customers, are always friendly. Is now my go-to location for taking time off.
Really neat place to go to and try a variety of food

Amazing and large! Lots of options

Must visit. Keep an eye in the cost of parking [P]
If you haven't visited..YOU NEED TO. An Exhilarating Experience that will make you want to come back for more. Love this place!

I have been to Op Hall a couple times now and love it.
There are so many vendors and seems like a few new ones since last time I went where you get to try all kinds of different food from different places.
I mean we can get pizza salad, barbecue, pokeballs, ramen, noodles, wraps, grilled cheeses, dim sum, pastries, ice cream and cocktails all in the same place!!!
I love the outside table sitting area. It's really pretty on a beautiful day, but I also like that they have a lot of indoor seating throughout the hall to eat at.
You get an hour and a half free for parking after you register your car, And after 3 hours for only 599 and there's also a full day is only $18.99 So still less than most parking garages in the city.
They have a couple cute shops. They could use a few more with fun Nicky-Nacky stuff, but overall a lovely place. A good spot,  to spend an afternoon, great to meet up with friends, or to bring people who are visiting the city.
Great place to bring friends and family
Great place to eat, congregate, and network!!

Busy food hall with a variety of restaurants. It never takes too long to get food. It's a great place to get lunch or dinner with friends, have a drink, a casual date, and is also family friendly with generous outdoor space and seating.

Lots of options for vegans and vegetarians.
Food was AMAZING! Fun atmosphere and plenty of food choices for everyone. The outdoor area is great for families and dog friendly.

Can't go wrong if you're hungry at Optimist Hall. Numerous eclectic restaurants, ie. Burgers, Ramen, Sushi, Chicken Sandwiches, NY Style Deli, Egyptian food, you name it. Fonta Flora Brewery on ground floor, additional beers on draft upstairs along with full bar. Plenty of outdoor/indoor seating, chill artsy vibe.

Pro Tip : (Parking can be tricky, make sure to use the parking app so you don't get fined)
I was amazed by Optimist Hall when visiting a friend in Charlotte.  The facility has a wide range of stores and restaurants. Parking was easy.
A place for people to dine in and hang out, u know for funzies.

I love this place. So many great food options from Southern BBQ to Korean Dumplings. I got smoked wings and mac & cheese at Noble Smoke and they were great. I also enjoyed the brewery next door, Fonta Flora, which has a beautiful outdoor space.
Always a great spot. Something for everyone!
Great place to go when you have a group of people that all want something different to eat. Great in door and outdoor seating.
Amazing place that is well maintained and pleasant environment!!

What a fantastic spot! There's a huge variety of food that caters to just about every taste, so everyone can find something delicious to enjoy. On a warm, sunny day, this place is just perfect. The outdoor space is truly the highlight--it's wonderful to relax out there! Optimist Hall draws a lovely, sophisticated crowd in Charlotte, which makes it even better. We felt totally safe while we were there! It seems a few folks might struggle with the parking situation, but that didn't impact our experience at all. A big shoutout for the friendly service; the whole place was clean and inviting. It's always a pleasure to visit!

an exciting 10/10 on all of the food!!!

ordering was quick and easy even on a busy saturday midday!!!

the photos are from different restaurants, i had the pork belly bao bun from bao and broth. it was tender sweet savory delicious overall the pork belly was high quality the bao bun was soft yet firm. it's everything you could want and for its price point it's a perfect appetizer!

dumplings from the dumpling lady. i ordered the pork and chives option. it was savory and light with a nice spicy kick. it was the kind of
spice that sneaks up on you after eating a couple. so many flavors it's a complex and delightful meal. would recommend if you're looking for something both spicy and savory. this Sichuan chinese style dumpling is a must get option.

Felix's empanadas. this was an Argentinian style empanada. i chose the pizza and pulled chorizo option. the pizza was perfect, a mix of cheese sauce and pepperoni! a decent size and not super overpriced. the pulled chorizo was filled to the brim. it was almost like pulled pork. the flavor is strong and may not be ur cup of tea if you can't stomach the chew. if you can get past that, you will be rewarded with a unique argentinian pork flavor.

frozen sangria from spindle bar. it was a nice sunny day and this hit the spot. fruity, refreshing, and a light drink to enjoy my food with. nothing to note here, just a fun spin on a classic drink.

For whatever reason, I want to like Optimist Hall more than I actually do.

I really like the concept, the service is usually excellent, but I just don't enjoy the food that much. We've been here probably a dozen times and it's never been good (except you Suarez sweets). I also find it to be extremely overpriced, especially cocktails at the bar. $17.00 (after tip) for a small plastic cup with an ounce of vodka and some flavoring seems a bit much.

Perhaps it's because I'm a bit more mature (age) than the younger crown that typically congregates here, its often difficult finding a place to sit (even on the least busy of days), and I find myself annoyed for just being there. I'm not even sure why this place puts me in a bad mood but it just does.

That being said, my wife loves the ramen and we'll continue to come and bring out-of-town guests as is the tradition, I guess.

Even the parking situation rubs me the wrong way. This place gives me an inexplicable case of the grumpies.

Best reason to go: Suarez's delicious desserts and cute stationary store.

Hint: you can see post-mortem animal parts that've been hacked off and dried for tasty play treats at the pet store!

Bored of daily office setting ? No feeling like working from home ?

This is the best place you can hang out to work, chill with buddies, talk your heart out with your partner or just soak in the calmness all by yourself!!
Great place, has a lot of good food options. Place is almost always crowded so finding a place to sit can be tricky, but the wide range of options for food makes it a great place
Great choices.   Good vibe.
Very very nice place!!! Pricey but honestly very nice
Fun, great dumplings, Empanada And pizza today with new couple very fun they loved
It was such a nice experience in nc! The empanadas were to die for
Everything about this place is top notch!!!
Great selection of food
So many options for food and shopping. Went for a work outting and will definitely be returning. The food did not disappoint!
An absolute must! From the food options to the shopping to boutiques to the brewery, truly something for everyone. Also loved reading about charlotte's mill history!
Nice place to poke around in stores, grab a bite and have a drink with friends
Nice food court and shops in NODA
Great selection of restaurants. Shops are nice.
Love this place
so inaccessible such a madhouse such a joke

I have been the the Optimist Hall a few times now. And the experience has been consistently great. Nice beer selections, wide range of food options and service times. Love the vibe with indoor/outdoor options. Have enjoyed Buns, Dumplings, brisket, empanadas, tapas, coffee and Gelato. Would certainly recommend a visit
Great place to enjoy good food.. if you need to do some work or just want to meet up and lounge.  Nice lunch spot.

Diverse food options, second to none. If you make the trip you won't be disappointed.
It's difficult to find parking and a place to sit once you get your food. This is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars.
We love optimist hall and never miss an opportunity to stop at this unique spot!

Great food court with so many options. Plenty of parking and it's free for first 90 mins which is great. Love the outdoor seating and play areas for kids and adults. Fun place. Would love to go there often.
Great vendors and excellent choices for food!

Tried the dumplings and we got sweet pork belly and chicken&shrimp, paid $25 for 20 dumplings that were smothered in their spicy house sauce... dangerously delicious! A fun place to visit in Charlotte especially when you can't decide on where to eat! So many vendors and they are all soo different! Went on a Saturday during dinner time so it was busy but still were able to get in and out fairly quickly and found place to eat as well! Fun to go with big groups as well!
Great place to find various types of food to eat options all in one location. Also, people don't mind sharing tables if needed. Food is delicious!
Great place to eat and spend time with family.
Need twice the parking spaces. Every Saturday is like the shopping mall on Black Friday.

There were so many vendors with such glorious food it was hard to decide what to eat. There is an amazing variety to choose from, the only thing I wish is that they had smaller portions so I could try a small amount from each vendor. I will definitely go back and try other vendors as I was only able to try two of them. Bottiwalla and Mezeh were both delicious.
Large selection of different cultures of food. Not a single place here has ever disappointed.
Love this place, one way to make everyone happy.  From burgers to ramen to dumplings, and to wash it down with cookies.

Move over Optimus Prime! This place packs a way harder punch! Every time we visit, my stomach hurts from over eating (yes, I'm admitting to gluttony).

There are so many options here, and you can't go wrong with your choice. The food is fast, fresh, and delicious.

After you are done and you can't eat another bite, make sure to grab dessert from one of several dessert places inside .

Visit, indulge, and enjoy!
I love the food hall atmosphere. This place is great and very helpful when you and your crew can't decide where to go.

I enjoyed my visit to Optimist Hall so much. My wife and I stopped here to grab lunch and ended up shopping at a few retail stores inside, grabbing an amazing Cuban  sandwich, fries,  coffee, dessert and toured the many amazing restaurant stalls. They have something for everyone.  Burgers, barbecue ,  ramen, pho,  dumplings, Indian food, and so much more. They also have  handicap accessible [P] parking and  restrooms.
Perfect for casual dining and when you need lots of options.
Love love love this place! A great place to bring friends with different tastes.

On food options, off the charts, finding a place to eat the food, ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIC.

I will not return without a place to sit.  Why have a place with so many places to buy food and no seating options!
Fun converted old mill repurposed for a food court with shops. Great for families. All vendors are locals. No chains. FYI - Parking is free for 90 minutes then you pay.

I love Optimist Hall for the variety of selections that make going out as a group a definite hit for everyone.
I highly recommend the empanadas, the burgers at Harriet's, the deli and of course the desert options.
First time here, and I will go back every time I'm in Charlotte! There are so many choices of ethnic foods. Great choice of adult beverages a well.
Nice place to get good food and chill.
Fun place to walk around. Great food. Great diversity of options.
My family and I had lunch at Optimist Hall Sunday and it was great. We had dumplings from The Dumpling Lady, Marina's Tapas, Felix's Empanadas and Zulu sushi and all three were great!
Delicious Indian Food Dishes served with better taste than it is actually served by many restaurants back at home.
Muchas variedades de comida y ambiente familiar
Great place with great food options. I could go here daily and never get tired of the selection.

There is so much to offer here, food-wise. Staff at each "booth" are generally awesome, but you do get a few who shouldn't be in this industry. Table space can be limiting for larger parties (like 21), but the turn-around is pretty quick, so nobody needs to get their nickers in a bunch, they just have to keep looking and larger tables open up. The variety of food is incredible and fantastic. And for smaller groups, EVERYONE is willing to share their table. It's really an awesome experience!
Expensive, crowded, employees act like you're a burden, parking is garbage, small portions.
Interesting concept, but not all the foods are worth trying and they definitely lacking a good coffee
It's like a food court with different vendor and great indoor and outdoor sitting area
Being from a small town i love this concept, but seating is nuts. Its feels like a huge game of musical chairs lol. Maybe ill take my own next time lol.
Lots of options, we enjoyed the diversity of the food.  Location was great, we walked!
Nice place
This is one of the best places for multiple options of food and leisure activities. I had come here multiple times and not one time was I disappointed in what you can eat and buy here.

I loved this novel concept of a stand alone food court. It was very crowded but did not find it difficult at all to find a table to eat at. I ate at Harriet's hamburgers. The food and service were no other excellent. The one problem, ketchup packets.
Relaxing
So many choices of places to eat...but it's the people there, and the good positive vibe the whole place has which makes it fun for a first date, or a family dinner.
Live it every time I come here!
Great place for variety of food options! We visited the place that had sushi (I don't recall the name) but the spicy salmon bowl was delicious and the salted caramel milk tea was also very flavorful!

Incredible food vendors and fun, lively atmosphere! So much left to try even after several visits. For fans of Indian and Mediterranean, Botiwalla and Mezeh are MUSTS!! Fonta Flora (1st floor) has exceptional craft brews. Lots of outdoor seating. Parking is easy via QR code scan, first 90 minutes free.
Maybe the greatest "food court" I have ever seen.  So many great choices.  Fantastic place for lunch, coffee or a drink.
big town atmosphere
Excelente lugar, diferente tipos de comidas un lugar para disfrutar con la familia.
Great place to meet with family or friends

Options were great. Love food halls for that reason. You can go with a group and everyone gets what they want. My husband and I shared Ethiopian food and a cubano. And they had Cafe cubano. Haven't been able to find that since we were in Miami.
Great place to try new foods or for everyone to get something different.
Such a vibe!  We had the Ethiopian food, Indian street food, boxcar betty, and bao buns!!!!  Everyone was super friendly and everything was fresh!
Place has a bunch of great food options and great outdoors when it's warm and great bar/drink options
Enjoy this place quite a few dining options and a really chic place to hang out and enjoy a meal.
Mostly great! I didn't love that we weren't given plates at the pizza place and the bar gave plastic and paper cups. Just wasn't the whole vibe. Food was decent and the drinks tasted good.
Nice
Super cool spot to visit for food, and drinks. The experience of the different eclectic vibes of all of the shops is top tier
Historic Mill era building that has been transformed into a loop of specialty quick serve restaurants.  The remaining space is shops to browse until you're hungry ;)
Love coming here! So many great options and things to do. Great place to bring friends and family
This is not the place for me. Loud, noisy and food that wants to be exotic but winds up being mundane.  If you are over 50 this is not the place for you
Went there a second time and no waiting! It was early on a weeknight. Tried Bao and Broth, and Cuban bakery. Everything tasted good. No cash accepted,  credit cards only.
Wonderful old mill turned food hall. Great variety of food to choose from. Parking is free for the first 90 minutes but can be tricky to find when busy.

a good place to go with a group of people as there are many options! went for coffee most recently, but i've gone to many of the food stalls. the sushi is always surprisingly good and people are obsessed with the burger joint and ramen here. i will say the bbq is less good at optimist since they don't smoke it there which makes perfect sense. suarez has great baked goods and the gelato place seems to be a fan favorite.

I had the pleasure of visiting in Semptember when my friends had an event and I came to support them. They invited me to dinner at optimist hall. The parking is free for up to 1.5 hours and there is a lot of parking but it is a very busy spot so the spaces quickly fill up.

There are bard/restaurants on on exterior, there are some shops as well but the FOOD! This place is packed with all kinds of food. Ethiopian, Indian, Mediterranean, Cuban Argentinian empanadas, American, Chinese and just such a wonderful diverse array of food. I have not had a single bad experience here.

The smashburgers are to die for, the dan dan noodles, empanadas, and the dumplings that you can get here are so wonderful. You will not regret stopping here and eating. The only issue with eating here is finding seating. It's a giant pain looking for seating. It's kind of a downer. But the food was spectacular and I will visit again and again.

This is our favorite place to go in Charlotte--esp to take people visiting. We usually go around lunchtime to avoid large crowds and trouble parking. Great atmosphere. Our family loves Boxcar Betty's (try the fried pickles!), Noble Smoke, and the Ramen place, but it's all good.

This is a food hall. An indoor area with a bunch of food places. It's basically a hipster spot with hipster cost. The coffee spot is like $15 for a piece of avocado toast.

The burger spot is the cheapest, but far from the best.  Grilled cheese place is good but crazy expensive, I think the tots were $14, no meat or anything crazy on them. The empanada spot is great and decent prices. The bakery had a surprisingly good Cubana sandwich. My lady really likes the bao place for noodles, though it's a little pricey. The chicken place has a super good pimento chicken sandwich and reasonable prices.  The BBQ spot is OK, but not for the price,  except the macaroni and cheese. It's one of like 2 places in Charlotte worth buying it at, though it's $5 for a small side but I'm willing to pay that for this. The pizza spot was probably the worst. Any time I've spoken to anyone who are there the pizza was either nearly raw or too hard to eat. The bar in back is a decent price. Not good for a date night, but good with a group.

Parking sucks something fierce. You get a short time free which is nice (used to be always free), but half the building is used by duke energy so during work ours there's around 100 cars parked here even though they have a lot across the street.

The vibe is awesome.! You get multiple cuisine options all in one place.! The outdoor seating is good and kids can play as well.! The restaurants have individual seating or you can opt in for common seating.!
Such a cool place to visit, they have a ton of unique food options and some cute little places to shop. The bao buns are my personal favorite.
It's a great place to take the family and friends.

Update: 1/8/25 Tried another restaurant (Meza) food tasty , fresh, and rice bowl enough for two people - excellent.
An unique eating establishment with more than 30 different restaurants and bars. A place where everyone in your group can find satisfying food.

Pros: plenty of seating areas inside and outside. Bars and restaurants located throughout the square. The courtyard is in the middle with a grassy area and seats.

Cons: Parking free for 90 minutes, after that $5.00 per 3 hours. Parking is expensive!

If you go try something different - you might be surprised!
Food was good and lots of options! Fairly crowded and a little overpriced, but it's a fun place to go in the area

Great place with tons of options to eat! You'll definitely find what you're craving. We tried a couple of these places some were more authentic than others.
The place is clean and pleasant to be in.
Fun place with alot of food options.

I had a Mediterranean bowl at Mezeh and it was excellent. Very large portion, very fresh ingredients, and presented nicely. I've eaten at a few places in Optimist Hall, and all are good and it's a very fun casual venue. It's especially fun to eat outside on warm sunny days.

Fun atmosphere! Unlimited food options. A little pricey.
Some really friendly; some unpleasant restaurant workers.

Love the whole food hall vibe, especially at the holidays. They decorate well and always have themed drinks. Tried the new tapas place today and it was fair. Still love my old standbys - Indian street food/ Asian dumplings and empanada place
Lot's of different types of good food, nice atmosphere!
Wonderful place to go to with several of options to choose from. A must place to go and try out several local food places and some shops.

Lots of outdoor seating with pretty good food options...gets way too crowded during weekends and recommend to go a little early in the evening to get a parking spot. A very good find especially during the covid times.
Never disappointed at Optimist Hall. The biggest problem is making a choice from all the great food options.
Great social spot with lots of good food options for anyone
This is one of my favorite food places in Charlotte. Lots of options for a diverse palate.
Food and drink were very good. Spindle Bar tenders were initially slow to acknowledge us sitting at the bar. We were initially confused about how/when to order.
Great place to hang out and find something to eat with the variety of foods they offer. One thing is parking can be tricky and seating is limited but overall great
Papi queso is the best grilled cheese I've ever had
It's a huge building with various restaurants and shops that you can purchase from and sit and eat and/or socialize with others. They also have a large bar!
Only downside is parking. Great choices!
Delicious food just super high prices! I had the Ethiopian restaurant and it was very fresh

Love the concept of a food hall to try out a little bit of something from different vendors at the same time. The Dumpling Lady was phenomenal. Will definitely be back. Parking can be a little tricky with the crowds and the free 90 minutes start as soon as your car gets scanned in their parking lot so we lost about 10 minutes just trying to find a spot.
This  was the Ethiopian restaurant, the food was delicious and the helping was plentiful.
Einmalig
It's mainly a giant food court. There are a couple shops.
Food Hall heaven. Go!
Schreiber's on Rye
This was a very fun experience visiting this food hall. There is lots of selections and I myself had Indian and I thought it was delicious.
Great options. Fun place to walk thru
Love this place. Great choices in food stalls. Just wish there were more inside seating
No where to sit. Ever. Every single time we come. Not worth it any more. Heaters are turned off tonight for the outside tables which would greatly help the problem.
Lots of great food and beverage choices. The Dumpling Lady has amazing dumplings!
Sehr schone Halle mit vielen Moglichkeiten fur unterschiedlichstes essen

This food court has a different variety of cuisines to choose from like Indian, Italian, Ethiopian and so on. Our family loved the atmosphere. We found many vegan dishes at many restaurants. We got a couple of vegan dishes from Bao and broth. The ramen and miso was not so great but the kids enjoyed it. The bell puri from Botiwalla was tasty and good. The vegan veggie pizza from Ava pizza was also good.
Great food, cool vibes, many options. Great for work or date night!
There is literally something for everyone here. Many vendors provide plant based options.
Great place! There's many places to eat and some shopping. There's also a place to get cocktails and drinks at one end of the Optimist Hall. Everything is sparkly clean and vibrant.
First  most of the food stands don't accept cash. The prices are way to high.
It's a great place to eat and hang out.  The whole parking app is a hassle but the food options are great, it will keep you coming back again and again
What a cool place to grab a bite to eat and shop at!
Muy rica la comida y el servicio excelente
Great food hall! The vibes are 10/10 (especially during the holidays, it was decorated so nicely!). Lots of seating options, inside and out. Great variety and selection of food.
mtHm AvKHl `m hmvn svgy mTbHym, Hbyb
Amazing variety and the atmosphere was great as well.
Great place to go with friends when you can't decide what to eat. Fun atmosphere and amazing food selection.
Nicely decorated with tons of different cuisine options. The place has a good vibe!
Great place with a awesome selection of food. Something for everyone.
I did not eat any food while I was there. Lots to see. Really great shops.
Variety of food junctions. Grilled cheese is one of the best followed by Botiwala

If you have any gluten allergies or don't eat meat, not really for you. My friends have none of those and enjoyed the atmosphere and food options. Myself, I really couldn't. Lower rating for lack of options. Outside of that definitely go and visit.
Optimist hall have great options of food, from Indian street food to pizzas, chill place for drinks, and a good time with family or friends
If you like variety, this is for you. Above par food for most any taste. Been nice to have more indoor or warmer seating on a cool night.
Great place for entire family. Everyone can get the food they want. We had Ethiopian Indian and Ramen while our kids were able to get chicken nuggets and cheeseburgers.
This place is the coolest food court I've ever been in. The choices were out of this world!

This was our first time. The place is decorated in artistic way so much to see and explore from food to even plants. We tried the famous The Dumpling Lady, Ethiopian food, Boa and buns and some more other places. So many options to choose from. They have plenty of space to sit inside and outside. It's just so crowded and the wait time for each food takes a lot. The restrooms were so clean for that crowd and fully stocked. They have lots of parking lots so you can find parking space somewhere just it might take to figure out and good part is it's free for 90 minutes.
Great food hall, several options
Lot of options to eat from. The atmosphere is nice.
Great food and service

Lots of food options, seating choices for all group sizes. The food options are a little pricey. Parking is free for the first 90 and you automatically get charged after that when using their parking lot. It is one of my favorite meet up spots for a quick lunch with a friend.
Moderne Foodhall.
Just had a coffee.  The food options were diverse and numerous.
We take people here every time we have out of town guests. There's something for everyone, and the food is often very unique and tasty.

Great concept.
I wish they had people walking around the clean tables.
Great family and friends gathering places
Great place with lots of good food choices.
Great place to shop for gifts and grab a vegan meal. Plenty of vegan and vegetarian options at multiple restaurants! Plant shop and stationary shop are so fun

One of the coolest places for food in charlotte. The Harriet's burger is solid, the chai at the Indian spot tastes just like the stuff in India, and the Chinese dumpling spot is pretty authentic. When I have guests from out of town, this is one of the places I take them, and they're always impressed. I love that you can go with a group and everyone can pick their own food, instead of trying to find somewhere that pleases everyone. They also play good music.
Tons of options and a cool vibe.
Yummy dumplings, melted cheese goodness and $8 champagne.

This was the perfect place to meet Friends for Lunch. There were several delicious FOOD options and plenty of seating areas. Be Aware, you have to pay for parking. Please scan and pay or you will receive a fine for $50 or close to that range.
Great place to meet up with friends. Wide variety of choices to eat
Parking was great and very affordable
A lovely food court with tons of food options and a nice sitting area outside. Definitely a good spot if you are in Charlotte.

Highly recommended by co-workers for dining experience in Charlotte. I been to so many food hall in many cities, this is one of the biggest one out there. It has something for everyone. Sweets, bbq, Chinese, American...you name it. They have a flower shop tuck at the back and a couple proper restaurant too.
Free parking for first hour, but it is usually so crowded that there are no where to sit. Cleaning crew is doing their job but during peak hours they just can't keep up.
Food is good, the best is probably the dumplings. BBQ and pizza you can get much better option in the city. Prices are higher than average though I think.  Nice place to hangout with friends if you find somewhere to sit.
Lovely hard to find parking though
Great place to eat, socialize , work , very good atmosphere

A must when visiting the area. Stopped for lunch. Tons of options. The staff we interacted with at each place (empanadas and burger places) were so sweet and nice. There is an outside eating area as well as some tables inside. Overall great vibes!

Note on parking: there are signs in the parking lot on how to pay. It was free for 90 mins I think (but you still have to register). It checks your time in/out when you automatically pull out per your license plate. You do not have to download an app, can do through a browser. I had a rental car and there was an option to only say it'd only be in my possession temporarily (good insight to the developers).
Great food and a really cool idea
Great food hall! Lots of vendors.  Very lively

On a Saturday afternoon, Optimist Hall is definitely the place to be, good food options, friendly staff at every establishment and great atmosphere.
Come support small businesses.
Such a cool atmosphere, good food... Time and time again!
Beautiful spot with a lot of places to sit and relax. Places for kids to play. Excellent food options with diversity of choices.

Came here in search of a food hall with great diversity--this place really delivered! I do not have and kids but I would say it's definitely kid-friendly. The parking lot is not that large so be prepared to go around a couple of times or park in another lot nearby. I had an amazing order of pork&chive dumplings from The Dumpling Lady, my husband had Tonkotsu ramen from Bao&Broth and my sister had pizza--all were incredible! The venue is also very family friendly and has other small shops inside such as a pet store and also a bar and a plant shop. The decor is really nice as well. 10/10
I can't wait to go back! So many options to choose from! We had burgers and NY deli subs and both were amazing.  Can't wait to go back for more!
A must go to place for the good food and atmosphere
Awesome atmosphere and large array of choices for good food and drink.

Always something unique and delightful to eat at Optimist Hall.  It's the perfect place to take family or friends when you just can't all agree on what you want to eat... you can reach find something here and enjoy your meal together.
Beware of the parking. There is a $25-$45+ parking fee through metropolis if you go over the first 90 minutes.
Place looks clean and great, food was delicious that we tried in different places in one visit. Price wise seemed little bit more expensive in general.
Great place lots of places to eat

We recently visited optimist hall and saw the parking was no longer free. They had a sign stating the first 90 minutes was free of charge so we made sure to leave before then. A month later I received a bill stating my vehicle was parked from exactly 7pm to 9pm and I have to pay $25 plus $5 late fee. We literally left before the 1.5 hours. I did not get there EXACTLY at 7 pm and we did not leave EXACTLY at 9pm. I was with a large group who left when I did and they didn't receive any ticket. Smells very very scammy. Definitely won't be visiting optimist hall again for this reason.
Love coming here so many options
Such a good variety of food.
I enjoyed the place very much. Plenty of food options and choice of foods. It was a great place to walk and shop and try different types of food.
Optimist Hall is a fun place with lots of easy parking. I checked out Harriett's Hamburgers and the food was delicious!
Neat place with alot of food choices! Highly recommend
Excellent variety of options to eat

SUPERIOR RESTAURANTS AND SERVICES THAT SUPPORT ALL ETHNIC DIVERSITY BACKGROUNDS... FAMILY ORIENTED ATMOSPHERE WITH NUMEROUS BUSINESSES TO SATISFY YOUR TASTE BUDDS... GREAT VIBES IN THE CITY FOR A CASUAL OR OPEN DRESS NO STRESS ENVIRONMENT.. ALSO SHOPS TO SHOP FOR DIFFERENT TYPES OF MERCHANDISE.

It's a cool idea how this is setup, just should have been planned differently for different people. Everyplace feels like the same environment and feels like the same food just worded differently. This place has lots of potential.
Excellent range of food outlets from subs, Asian food and pizza. The courtyard in the middle is a great spot to eat your food.
Nice spot to bring a group of out-of-towners to. Lots of choices. Clean, safe environment.
Great place to come for work or leisure. Large selection of local food options and some unique retail shops.

Wide variety of foods, I ate from Papi Queso and the service took a while but they offered a free drink and a bag of fries for the inconvenience. Atmosphere is great at night and they allow dogs on the outdoor patio. If you go as a family, it could get pricey
